html: The name “Edom” or “red” (’edom) derives from the red pottage Jacob cooked with which he purchased his father’s birthright from his twin elder brother Esau (Genesis 25:29-34). Esau’s descendants—and all who sell their spiritual birthright for a “mess of pottage” or its equivalent—thus identify with Edom. Beginning with Esau’s intention to kill Jacob (Genesis 27:42), to his descendants’ betrayal of Judah to the Babylonians (Psalm 137:7; Obadiah 1:9-10), all who emulate Esau’s treachery incur Jehovah’s “damnation” (herem). The archtyrant—Jehovah’s sword—will slay them (Isaiah 66:15-16).
